Package org.neo4j.kernel.impl.storemigration

Class RecordStorageMigrator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.storageengine.migration.AbstractStoreMigrationParticipant
      • org.neo4j.kernel.impl.storemigration.RecordStorageMigrator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StoreMigrationParticipant
    public class RecordStorageMigrator
extends AbstractStoreMigrationParticipant
    Migrates a RecordStorageEngine store from one version to another.

    Since only one store migration is supported at any given version (migration from the previous store version) the migration code is specific for the current upgrade and changes with each store format version.

    Just one out of many potential participants in a migration.

    • Method Detail

      • migrate

        public void migrate​(DatabaseLayout directoryLayout,
                    DatabaseLayout migrationLayout,
                    ProgressReporter progressReporter,
                    String versionToMigrateFrom,
                    String versionToMigrateTo)
             throws IOException,
                    KernelException
        Description copied from interface: StoreMigrationParticipant
        Performs migration of data this participant is responsible for if necessary. Data to migrate sits in sourceDirectory and must not be modified. Migrated data should go into targetStoreDir, where source and target dirs are highest level database store dirs.
        Parameters:
        directoryLayout - data to migrate.
        migrationLayout - place to migrate to.
        progressReporter - migration progress monitor
        versionToMigrateFrom - the version to migrate from
        versionToMigrateTo - the version to migrate to
        Throws:
        IOException - if there was an error migrating.
        KernelException

      • migrateCountsStore

        private void migrateCountsStore​(DatabaseLayout directoryLayout,
                                DatabaseLayout migrationLayout,
                                RecordFormats oldFormat,
                                PageCursorTracer cursorTracer,
                                MemoryTracker memoryTracker)
                         throws IOException
        Rebuilds the counts store by reading from the store that is being migrated from. Instead of a rebuild this could have been done by reading the old counts store, but since we don't want any of that complex code lingering in the code base a rebuild is cleaner, but will require a longer migration time. Worth it?
        Throws:
        IOException

      • specificTransactionInformationSupplier

        private static TransactionId specificTransactionInformationSupplier​(long lastTransactionId)
        In case if we can't find information about transaction in logs we will create new transaction information record. Those should be used only in case if we do not have any transaction logs available during migration. Logs can be absent in two possible scenarios:
        1. We do not have any logs since there were not transaction.
        2. Logs are missing.
        For both of those cases specific informational records will be produced.
        Parameters:
        lastTransactionId - last committed transaction id
        Returns:
        supplier of custom id records.

      • moveMigratedFiles

        public void moveMigratedFiles​(DatabaseLayout migrationLayout,
                              DatabaseLayout directoryLayout,
                              String versionToUpgradeFrom,
                              String versionToUpgradeTo)
                       throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: StoreMigrationParticipant
        After a successful migration, move all affected files from upgradeDirectory over to the workingDirectory, effectively activating the migration changes.
        Parameters:
        migrationLayout - directory where the migration put its files.
        directoryLayout - directory the store directory of the to move the migrated files to.
        versionToUpgradeFrom - the version we have migrated from
        versionToUpgradeTo - the version we want to migrate to
        Throws:
        IOException - if unable to move one or more files.
